dcterms:creator: S. Bowman
G. Angeli
C. Potts
C. Manning
dcterms:description: The Stanford Natural Language Inference (SNLI) dataset is the largest collection of human-generated premise and hypothesis pairs for the NLI task, with over 570,000 examples. It was collected through a crowd-sourcing campaign where samples and labels were created by human annotators, with labels decided by majority vote to minimize noise.
dcterms:title: SNLI (Stanford Natural Language Inference)

dcterms:description: A collection of text pairs in German language collected from various online sources, including news, tweets, company ratings, game reviews, and product reviews. The dataset is manually annotated for the contradiction detection task.
dcterms:title: Online Data Set
